pages.title: Thuchomyces
pages.text: $(l)Temporal Range:$() Archean (Mesoarchean)$(br2)$(l)Habitat:$() Terrestrial$(br2)>$(o)incertae sedis$(br2)$(l)Propagation:$() $(l:basics/collecting_plants)Spore-bearing plants$(/l)$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Shears

Thuchomyces lichenoides comes from the Upper Mesoarchean, with fossils from the Central Rand Group, South Africa. It is a collection of upright tube shapes, and grew up to 3 mm in height. The generic name derives from the mineral name 'thucholite', and the Greek word 'myces', to mean 'fungus'. The specific name derives from the name 'Lichen' and the Latin word 'oid', to mean 'like'.
